data.title: Need more staff
data.text: My friend and I were recently attending a concert , the place was near the coliseum and so we decided to stop in . The staff was attentive at the door . And asked if we had reservations , and we didn't so we were invited to the bar . We went and sat at the bar which had enough space for 6 people . Where we were about to sit , there was a juicer and the bartender asked us to move to a table because he needed that space . So we went and sat at the table , and sat , and sat . Finally the bartender gave us a drink menu , and then came back after 5 - 10 minutes and took our order , then another 10 minutes to ask for the dinner menu . Again another wait to order , and another wait about 20 minutes for the food , which was going to a different table and the bartender had to look at the open tickets to see where it went . The food was good , but don't see me going back . The lack of attention to the bar area by the staff  and the manager needs work ....

data.title: Great, reasonably priced food close to Richmond Coliseum
data.text: Prior to attending a recent concert at the Richmond Coliseum, I had an opportunity to dine at this restaurant. The food was delicious and was prepared exactly as ordered. Even though the restaurant was filled to near capacity, the servers were efficient and friendly, and the food arrived amazingly quickly. Upon entering the restaurant, the space appears somewhat small. However, a spacious dining area is located downstairs. In addition to the great food and efficient service, one of the major advantages of this restaurant is its proximity to the Richmond Coliseum and to the Richmond convention center. The only reason I did not give a five star rating was that my reservation made the day prior to my visit had not been recorded. However, this did not prove to be a problem as the hostess was able to find a table for us.

data.title: So disappointing.
data.text: I've been wanting to try vagabond for lunch since it is within walking distance of my office. After looking over the menu, I called and ordered the General Tso's Chicken Bento Box to go. I was told it would be about 25 minutes before my order was ready which I thought was a little long. The to go bag they put the small take out container in was huge, much too large for the container. When I got back to my office I realized I wasn't given any take out utensils. I had to walk around my office asking people for a plastic fork which was less than ideal. I then opened the container and was so disappointed. There was maybe 2 teaspoons of "fried rice", no asparagus, and no cupcake! There was a cookie but I think it was supposed to be gingerbread and it tasted awful. The box contained 6 pieces of fried "General Tso's" chicken, barely any rice and an inedible cookie. Definitely not keeping this on my list of lunch places!

data.title: Unusual and Delicious!
data.text: Creative chef and unusual food!!! We were a large business party for dinner and both servers were superb!  Appetizers ranged from Oysters to Beet Hummus.  I liked them all.  I also had the pear and feta salad which was really tasty.  For dinner, I chose the duck; although the duck meat was a bit tough to chew, it was delicious and extremely creative combination of different ingredients that somehow combined together perfectly!  For dessert, I had their flan.  Outstanding!

data.title: Solid, affordable lunch choice
data.text: We were down and MCV and VCU and needed a spot for lunch.  Vagabond was close by so we gave it a try.  The sandwiches and salads were good as was the chocolate torte for dessert.  Prices were very responsible.

data.title: Much better than what was there before
data.text: I work downtown and this is one of the few restaurants I can walk to, so I was hoping it was good.  There is a real chef there and the prices are so reasonable.  I had lunch and I wanted to order the gelato, but it hadn't not been made yet for that day.  While disappointed I appreciate that they make their own and am eager to try it another day.

owner_response.author: Peter W, Owner at Vagabond, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hey There - thanks for the kind words. I hope you come back for that gelato very soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Lunch
data.text:
Wife found this place while traveling with me on business. Had an outstanding lunch.  I had the turkey sandwich and she had the garden salad with steak.  All was very good. 

The service is prompt, very friendly as well as very knowledgable about the chefs various creations. If your lucky maybe they will be serving white bean and potato soup!!!  Very good. Cool looking little bar area also 

Highly recommend this place for lunch.

owner_response.author: Peter W, Owner at Vagabond, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the kind words. I'm so glad you had just a great experience with us. I hope that we can be your go-to lunch spot in your travels to Richmond.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: great lunch
data.text: bit expensive for lunch prices, but good quality. curried chicken tasted great but could have used a little more "kick"; top-notch fries. shrimp po' boy I was told tasted great (but a bit on the small side). Chicken wings were also great as was the beer bread

owner_response.author: Peter W, Owner at Vagabond, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Chris - thanks for the review and feedback. I hope we'll see you again very soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dinner with out of town friends
data.text: Amazing food and drink! We had the rock fish and it was outstanding! Kudos to Vagabond! As a group, we have tried several local restaurants. Yours- hands down- was the best and the only one that received " let's go again"!

owner_response.author: Peter W, Owner at Vagabond, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much! I hope we see you again very, very soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice place for lunch
data.text: Convenient spot right across from the courthouse (next to the National). Stopped in for a quick lunch with my daughter.  We both had the BLT with fries, which was quite tasty, the bacon especially so. Will definitely come back for dinner.

owner_response.author: Peter W, Owner at Vagabond, responded to this review
owner_response.text: That bacon is great! Chef Owen makes it from scratch with pork from Autumn Olive Farm in the Shenandoah Valley. See you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pre-Show Dinner before concert at the National
data.text: Very good food and atmosphere. Would definitely return. Location is next to The National so it is very convenient.

owner_response.author: Peter W, Owner at Vagabond, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Catherine - thanks for the review! Hope we see you again very soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pleasant experience and excellent food
data.text:
We greatly enjoyed our meal here (dinner) and also found it to be a better value than the other restaurant we tried for dinner during our weekend in Richmond (Juleps reviewed separately).

The atmosphere was unique and rather eclectic, and the staff was very friendly to go along with their attentive service.  The menu was intriguing (a bit too much so for my simple palette), and is based on plate sizes (small, medium, and large).  I ordered a large plate, the hanger steak, while my wife opted for two small plates, beef tartar and a special brochette.

All of our food was excellent!  It was beautifully prepared and had wonderful combinations of flavor.  We enjoyed our meals enough that we wanted to try their deserts... once again winners on both counts.  Additionally, Vagabond was a better value than the other restaurant we had visited.  We had two entrees (I'm counting the two small plate as one entree), two glasses of wine and two deserts, and spent about $120.

While this is certainly not "cheap eats," it compares quite favorably with other restaurants downtown.  We would definitely return and do recommend this restaurant.

owner_response.author: Peter W, Owner at Vagabond, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review! I hope we can see you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Interesting and tasty
data.text:
This was our first visit to this restaurant as it was our first time to a concert at The National next door.

First of all, what a cool renovation of the space and a nice choice of varied seating -- upstairs, downstairs, at either bar or along the window looking outside. My only complaint was the seats were not comfortable; they had thick cushions on them which may have been an attempt to make them more comfortable but it didn't work for me.

We both enjoyed our meals here - they have good iced tea and my wife scores high any restaurant with ginger beer for a Dark & Stormy. We had the wings, a mixed green salad and Poole verde. And we tossed our diet aside and had delicious cheesecake and churros for dessert.

No complaints at all about our server Brooke R. And when we asked her the source of the obnoxious beeping we tried so hard to ignore our entire meal, she explained the problem and admitted it was driving them all batty!

data.title: Exceptional!
data.text:
I came here with my wife and another couple on a Thursday night.  This place is obviously a local's favorite but still intimate despite it's popularity.

Every single thing we ordered was perfectly prepared.  It has a great atmosphere, and Owen the Chef/ Owner even came out to check on us.  

Our server Matthew never skipped a beat with the plethora of questions we asked of him and he was very knowledgable about the menu and local ingredients.

I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area and will definitely return!

owner_response.author: Peter W, Owner at Vagabond, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks or the review, Blake. Hope to see you again in the near future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Go to the speakeasy in the basement
data.text: We went to vagabound during restaurant week.  Loved Jane our server and she knew the menu and suggested the cheese beer bread and other appetizers.  Rockfish was out of this world and loved the atmosphere.  Great chef and a real plus at the national..do yourself a favor and go indulge!!

owner_response.author: Peter W, Owner at Vagabond, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review, Jayne. That rockfish Chef Owen was getting was spectacular wasn't it? He was getting it in fresh daily. You come back on a Monday for The Vagabond Road Trip Food Carnival! Our menu transforms each Monday to reflect the culinary tastes of different parts of the world. See you soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delightfully different!
data.text: We decided to eat here after buying tickets for a show next door at the National and found that we would get 1st access if we ate at Vagabond. SO GLAD WE DID! My husband and I do not get the opportunity very often to stretch our palates; we are simple eaters.  But we certainly enjoyed ourselves here.  The cheese beer bread, braised pork cheeks, and the pig head Banh mi were delicious.  Didn't care very much for the smoked chicken wings; too chewy for public dining. :)  The plates are small but I like that since it gives you more room to try different items. Yes, I recommend highly at least visiting when you feel adventurous. And DEFINITELY when you have tix for the National! The "back stairs" access is worth it BUT not handicapped friendly (one long, winding, narrow flight of stairs).

owner_response.author: Peter W, Owner at Vagabond, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review! I'd say you stretched your palate with the pig head bahn mi. It really is amazing isn't it? If you come back for another show at The National and have someone in your party who may be handicapped, we'd be happy to work it out with the staff at The National to get them through the elevator if the stairs are a bit too much. See you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Ok
data.text: 4 friends met here for lunch.  We all agreed the beer selection was OK. The service was slow, but the waiter was friendly and answered our menu questions. We had 4 different menu selections and everyone thought they were again ok, but nothing special. Tacos could have been spiced up a bit. Curried potato salad very good.

owner_response.author: Peter W, Owner at Vagabond, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Randy - thanks for the review. I hope you come back again soon - we'be made some changes to the Lunch menu for the summer and I think you'll be pleased.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fresh! Comfort Food Menu!
data.text:
The complimentary valet was wonderful to avoid parking downtown, and right next to the National theatre means you should definitely consider it next time pre-show! 
Loved the appetizer selections, the tartar was perfectly seasoned and housemade crackers were excellent, beer cheese bread seemed like it would be out of place but was delicious, and all of the entrees felt well established and put together with thoughtfulness. Tried almost every cocktail and have to say that only the bourbon special and the airmail classic were to my palate, but perhaps next time we'll do a wine instead. I'm not sure about the other mid plates, but the one we had wasn't noticeably much bigger than the smalls ... I think it's just a price break that they chose to split some off because of higher cost/time/ingredients, so consider that before you think you could order a mid plate salad and call that dinner ... definitely will need something more, no matter how small an eater! Enjoy~!

owner_response.author: Peter W, Owner at Vagabond, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review! Hope to see you again soon. Maybe on a Wednesday (1/2 off bottles of wine night)?
owner_response.title: Owner Response
